intro: Aporosa wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan rosewood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and wood quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
